definition: (onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
pent-up unspoken grievances/suffering not willingly or possibly spoken of
no choice but to suffer in silence (idiom)/also written 啞巴吃黃蓮|哑巴吃黄莲/(often precedes 有苦說不出|有苦说不出[you3 ku3 shuo1 bu5 chu1])
to be forced to suffer in silence/unable to speak of one's bitter suffering

sentences.english: However, they occasionally snort, hiss, or bark.
sentences.chinese: 不過啞天鵝偶爾會發出呼哧聲，噓聲，或吼聲。

sentences.english: " No ! No ! " you might shout yourself hoarse.
sentences.chinese: 別這樣，你會把嗓子喊啞的。

sentences.english: I have a runny nose and a scratchy throat.
sentences.chinese: 我流鼻涕，嗓子還又疼又啞。

sentences.english: Most of the people become dull and dumb.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人變得又遲鈍又啞。

sentences.english: She came up hoarse for the singing.
If the inflammation while delays until the free time department to present the sound to shout mutely.
sentences.chinese: 如果炎症趁延至暇部則出現聲音喊啞。

sentences.english: NO12,9. My voice is getting hoarse.
I can’t get a dial tone on the phone; it’s dead.
sentences.chinese: 我的電話沒有撥音號，完全啞了。
歌手聲嘶力竭地演唱，連嗓子都喊啞了。

sentences.english: Terminals are no longer dumb, and clients are no longer very thin.
sentences.chinese: 不再使用啞終端，不再存在非常瘦的客戶機。

sentences.english: I looked at him in silent wonder.
sentences.chinese: 我非常驚訝，啞囗無言地看着他。

sentences.english: They shut down, becoming suddenly limp and still.
sentences.chinese: 他們停機了，變得又瘸又啞。

sentences.english: The tree comes up to my window like the yearning voice of the dumb earth.
sentences.chinese: 樹木伸到我的窗前，如瘖啞的大地發出渴慕的聲音。

sentences.english: She became hoarse from shouting during the baseball game.
sentences.chinese: 她看棒球賽時把嗓子喊啞了。

definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
